result.eng: The politicians must cut down on their expenses.
result.ga: Caithfidh na polaiteoirí gearradh siar ar a gcuid costas
result.orig: Caithfidh na polaiteoirí gearradh siar ar a gcuid costas
result.html: Caithfidh na polaiteoirí gearradh siar ar a gcuid costasThe politicians must cut down on their expenses.
result.ponchtml: Caiṫfiḋ na polaiteoirí gearraḋ siar ar a gcuid costasThe politicians must cut down on their expenses.

result.eng: When will you be going back to Galway?
result.ga: Cathain a bheidh tú ag dul siar go Gaillimh
result.orig: Cathain a bheidh tú ag dul siar go Gaillimh
result.html: Cathain a bheidh tú ag dul siar go GaillimhWhen will you be going back to Galway?
result.ponchtml: Caṫain a ḃeiḋ tú ag dul siar go GailliṁWhen will you be going back to Galway?

result.eng: I think back of the days of my youth.
result.html: Cuimhním siar ar laethanta m'óigeI think back of the days of my youth.
result.ponchtml: Cuiṁním siar ar laeṫanta m'óigeI think back of the days of my youth.

result.html: Baineadh siar asamI was taken aback.
result.ponchtml: Baineaḋ siar asamI was taken aback.

result.eng: We're two miles west of An Spidéal.
result.ga: Táimid dhá mhíle siar ón Spidéal
result.orig: Táimid dhá mhíle siar ón Spidéal
result.html: Táimid dhá mhíle siar ón SpidéalWe're two miles west of An Spidéal.
result.ponchtml: Táimid ḋá ṁíle siar ón SpidéalWe're two miles west of An Spidéal.

result.eng: There was sand to every side of us, east and west, north and south.
result.ga: Bhí gaineamh do gach leith dínn soir siar thuaidh theas
result.orig: Bhí gaineamh do gach leith dínn soir siar thuaidh theas
result.html: Bhí gaineamh do gach leith dínn soir siar thuaidh theasThere was sand to every side of us, east and west, north and south.
result.ponchtml: Ḃí gaineaṁ do gaċ leiṫ dínn soir siar ṫuaiḋ ṫeasThere was sand to every side of us, east and west, north and south.

result.eng: She wasn't a woman who'd go back on her word [who wouldn't do what she'd said she'd do].
result.ga: Níor bhean í a chuaigh siar ar a focal
result.orig: Níor bhean í a chuaigh siar ar a focal
result.html: Níor bhean í a chuaigh siar ar a focalShe wasn't a woman who'd go back on her word [who wouldn't do what she'd said she'd do].
result.ponchtml: Níor ḃean í a ċuaiġ siar ar a focalShe wasn't a woman who'd go back on her word [who wouldn't do what she'd said she'd do].

result.eng: She had promised it to him – she couldn't back out now.
result.ga: Gheall sí dó é – ní fhéadfadh sí dul siar air sin anois
result.orig: Gheall sí dó é – ní fhéadfadh sí dul siar air sin anois
result.html: Gheall sí dó é – ní fhéadfadh sí dul siar air sin anoisShe had promised it to him – she couldn't back out now.
result.ponchtml: Ġeall sí dó é – ní ḟéadfaḋ sí dul siar air sin anoisShe had promised it to him – she couldn't back out now.

result.eng: Cane was planted in the Caribbean area and cotton further west and north.
result.ga: Cuireadh cána i gceantar na Cairibe agus cadás níos faide siar agus ó thuaidh
result.orig: Cuireadh cána i gceantar na Cairibe agus cadás níos faide siar agus ó thuaidh
result.html: Cuireadh cána i gceantar na Cairibe agus cadás níos faide siar agus ó thuaidhCane was planted in the Caribbean area and cotton further west and north.
result.ponchtml: Cuireaḋ cána i gceantar na Cairibe agus cadás níos faide siar agus ó ṫuaiḋCane was planted in the Caribbean area and cotton further west and north.

result.eng: As the country spread out west, more states joined the union that did not accept slavery.
result.ga: Mar a leath an tír siar amach tháinig níos mó stáit isteach san aontacht nár ghlac le sclábhaíocht
result.orig: Mar a leath an tír siar amach tháinig níos mó stáit isteach san aontacht nár ghlac le sclábhaíocht
result.html: Mar a leath an tír siar amach tháinig níos mó stáit isteach san aontacht nár ghlac le sclábhaíochtAs the country spread out west, more states joined the union that did not accept slavery.
result.ponchtml: Mar a leaṫ an tír siar amaċ ṫáinig níos mó stáit isteaċ san aontaċt nár ġlac le scláḃaíoċtAs the country spread out west, more states joined the union that did not accept slavery.
